intro: Homalocalyx pulcherrimus, commonly known as the beautiful flame tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a vibrant display. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are actinomorphic, with five petals and numerous stamens, typical of the Rubiaceae family. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
